etymologies: Old English tæppa ‘peg for the vent-hole of a cask’, tæppian ‘provide (a cask) with a stopper’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch tap and German Zapfen (nouns)

definitions: a device by which a flow of liquid or gas from a pipe or container can be controlled

examples.text: she turned the cold tap on

shortDefinitions: device by which flow of liquid or gas from pipe or container can be controlled

definitions: an electrical connection made to some point between the end terminals of a transformer coil or other component.
shortDefinitions: electrical connection made to some point between end terminals of transformer coil

definitions: a device connected to a telephone used for listening secretly to someone's conversations

examples.text: those taps produced hundreds of hours of recordings

shortDefinitions: device connected to telephone for listening secretly to someone's conversations

definitions: an act of listening secretly to someone's telephone conversation.
shortDefinitions: act of listening secretly to someone's telephone conversation

definitions: an instrument for cutting a threaded hole in a material.
shortDefinitions: instrument for cutting threaded hole in material

definitions: a taproom.
shortDefinitions: taproom

definitions: draw liquid through the tap or spout of (a cask, barrel, or other container)

examples.text: bragging of tests they had aced and kegs they had tapped

shortDefinitions: draw liquid through tap or spout of

definitions: draw (liquid) from a cask, barrel, or other container

examples.text: the butlers were tapping new ale

shortDefinitions: draw liquid from container

definitions: draw sap from (a tree) by cutting into it.
shortDefinitions: draw sap from tree by cutting into it

definitions: exploit or draw a supply from (a resource)

examples.text: clients from industry seeking to tap Philadelphia's resources of expertise
these magazines have tapped into a target market of consumers

shortDefinitions: exploit or draw supply from

definitions: obtain money or information from (someone)

examples.text: he considered whom he could tap for information

shortDefinitions: obtain money or information from

definitions: connect a device to (a telephone) so that conversation can be listened to secretly

examples.text: the telephones were tapped by the state security police

shortDefinitions: connect device to telephone so that conversation can be listened to secretly

definitions: cut a thread in (something) to accept a screw

examples.text: on most vices, the metal jaws are drilled and tapped to accept screws

shortDefinitions: cut thread in something to accept screw

etymologies: Middle English: from Old French taper, or of imitative origin; compare with clap and rap

definitions: strike (someone or something) with a quick light blow or blows

examples.text: one of my staff tapped me on the shoulder

shortDefinitions: strike with quick light blow or blows

definitions: strike (something) against something else with a quick light blow or blows

examples.text: Gloria was tapping her feet in time to the music

shortDefinitions: strike something against something else with quick light blow

definitions: produce (a rhythm) with a series of quick light blows on a surface

examples.text: drums that tapped out a rumba beat

shortDefinitions: produce rhythm with series of quick light blows on surface

definitions: write or enter (something) using a keyboard or keypad

examples.text: he tapped out a few words on the keyboard

shortDefinitions: write or enter something using keyboard or keypad

definitions: designate or select (someone) for a task or honor, especially membership of an organization or committee

examples.text: he had been tapped earlier to serve in Costa Rica

shortDefinitions: designate or select for task or honour

definitions: a quick light blow, or the sound of such a blow

examples.text: there was a sharp tap at the door

shortDefinitions: quick light blow, or sound of such blow

definitions: tap dancing

examples.text: a rhythm much used in tap

shortDefinitions: tap dancing

definitions: a piece of metal attached to the toe and heel of a tap dancer's shoe to make a tapping sound.
shortDefinitions: piece of metal attached to toe and heel of tap dancer's shoe to make tapping sound

definitions: a bugle call for lights to be put out in army quarters
etymologies: so named because the signal was originally sounded on a drum
shortDefinitions: bugle call for lights to be put out in army quarters

definitions: a bugle call sounded at a military funeral.
shortDefinitions: bugle call sounded at military funeral
